page.title: 03HANDICAPPED CHILDREN CHESTER
page.content: {DORIN PARK SCHOOL}HAS 92 PUPILS AGED BETWEEN 2 AND 18 WHO COME FROM A RADIUS OF 20 MILES.SOME SUFFER FROM CEREBRAL PALSY,SPINA BIFIDA,MUSCULAR DYSTROPHY,CYSTIC FIBROSIS,DELAYED DEVELOPMENT AND THE RESULTS OF ROAD TRAFFIC ACCIDENTS.THE NURSERY DEPARTMENT IS AN ASSESSMENT UNIT AND SOME PUPILS ARE TRANSFERRED TO SCHOOLS FOR THE MENTALY HANDICAPPED.THERE ARE 38 STAFF AND 7 VISITING MEDICAL AND ORTHOPAEDIC SURGEONS AND CONSULTANTS. THE AIM OF THE SCHOOL IS TO MAKE CHILDREN AS INDEPENDENT AS POSSIBLE.ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RIDING, CANOEING,ARCHERY,CAMPING AT HOME AND ABROARD AND WHEELCHAIR DANCING.SENIORS TAKE CSE AND 'O'LEVEL EXAMINATIONS. SINCE THE WARNOCK REPORT PARENTS CAN HAVE CHILDREN ASSESSED TO ATTEND MAIN STREAM EDUCATION WHERE POSSIBLE.
